repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/26744

Windows did not support underline syles other than the regular one. no undercurl or double line . but with the latest merge these has been implemented and planned for https://github.com/microsoft/terminal/pull/16097.

in the latest Preview you can see this in action using powershell >= 6 (Cmd as far as i know does not support escape chars. correct me if i am wrong )

using both
```
Write-Host "`e[4:3mtest`e[0m"
Write-Host "`e[4:3;58:2::000:255:000mtest`e[0m"
```
will print both colored non colored undercurl

![292871937-1c559811-e124-4354-8d67-cacc0f3f78a2](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/27051374/71d3c54f-ed0d-4ad5-91a3-9c12e61bd2b9)

Adding the paramaters in the terminfo for vtpcon will give full support for underline style rendering in native windows. I assume this will also give support to other terminals other than windows terminal like wezterm and alacritty as  these are relient on windows terminal conptty implementation which should update as soon as the preview branch merge into the stable one. 

To test this out download the latest Windows terminal Preview from either github or Windows store.

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/27051374/c84e089e-2d0b-480a-a012-1cb6de8b0871)

Thanks to @tusharsnx and @kmoschcau for the inspiration.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion

```

You should get rid of this include and instead remove the header gaurd (`#ifdef __FreeBSD__` and `#endif`) around the `nvim/os/os.h` include. That should include the required `os_getenv()` (or `os_env_exists()` as I suggested in another comment) correctly.
Thank you for your suggestions. will apply the changes and test it out

comment_regular_data.body: Thank you BTW for your time and for reviewing @zeertzjq . And sorry for the mess created earlier on.

@ajmandourah Thanks for doing this! 


An important point we need to discuss is

Have you tested this on terminals that do not support colored underlines (`SGR 58/59`) and extended underline styles (`SGR 4:X`)?

The problem with these sub parameter (colon `:` syntax) based control sequences are, if we send the sequence to unsupported terminals, they'll not render anything.

Neovim, when not using `SGR 4:X` and `SGR 58`, sends standard `SGR 4` for all underlines (except double underline `SGR 21`), and don't even send `SGR 58` at all. This is important to keep unsupported terminals working as usual.

Unfortunately, feature detection in terminals isn't the best. You could've used [DECRQSS](https://vt100.net/docs/vt510-rm/DECRQSS.html) and [DECRPSS](https://vt100.net/docs/vt510-rm/DECRPSS.html), but that'll let you know the capability of backing conhost and not of the terminal user is interacting with 

So, I think we should add a config like `compatibility.legacy_underline_styles` to help user revert to older behavior (i.e only `SGR 4` and no `SGR 4:X`). Sending `SGR 58` to unsupported terminals won't hurt I guess. I'm also not an nvim expert, so maybe there's already a way to turn off extended styles. In that case, mentioning that in the docs should be enough

@tusharsnx 

You are right.  here is a comparision

left: with current modification. current windows terminal (underline styles + colors not supported yet)
middle: with old terminfo. current windows terminal (underline styles + colors not supported yet)
right: with modifications. windows terminal preview (with support for underline styles and colors)

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/27051374/8f8e815e-aa3d-4c0b-b3d0-02ab2266876e)

from my understanding other terminals like Putty for example have their own terminfo defined in the terminfo_defs.h I made sure not to touch those .

So, what we are looking for is to get _left_ to work as _middle_ with the current changeset. Can we (as a user) edit `Smulx` (or something similar) to get the terminal on the _left_ to show the missing underlines?

> So, what we are looking for is to get _left_ to work as _middle_ with the current changeset. Can we (as a user) edit `Smulx` (or something similar) to get the terminal on the _left_ to show the missing underlines?

You are probably right but the question is if we really need to do so . I have just tried alacritty and wezterm, 2 of the most popular terminals for windows and they both shows the correct underline (middle). As Windows terminal will eventually will support underlines when they merge it into the stable which i recon to be soon, I doubt we will need to implement a feature which may not be used. 

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/27051374/5d1d75b4-20a4-4ac3-b6ad-5df91de96de8)

again . other terminals like putty and conemu have their own terminfo defined in the header file so these probably wont be affected. did not try though .

> You are probably right but the question is if we really need to do so.

I think we need it because it's considered as a breaking change for unsupported terminals. This is probably why Neovim blocks this feature unless a terminal explicitly says (through terminfo, or similar methods) that it supports these extended control sequences.

> I doubt we will need to implement a feature which may not be used

This will used as a last resort for unsupported terminals. Though, we might not need it right now 

*I'm okay with what core maintainers think is right for Neovim to do here.*

Fair. Do you happen to know what terminals other than the mentioned above ? i will try to test them out and see how they react . To be honest i don't know if its possible to modify only the terminfo files only without touching the source code for the implementation to get the desire outcome. i don't feel very comfortable but i will try my best.

Turns out the latest windows terminal stable Windows Terminal Version: 1.19.10302.0 is already supporting colorized underlines. (my laptop was outdated and refused to update from the app store. a manual installation from github fixed it)
Enabling this unconditionally doesn't seem ideal. Is it possible for a program running in Windows Terminal to get the version of the terminal?

> Enabling this unconditionally doesn't seem ideal. Is it possible for a program running in Windows Terminal to get the version of the terminal?

There is `wt -v`. Will come back home and test it out.

Other than that I think it's possible to query windows registry for it. Dunno if admin privileges are required for reading it though. 

UPDATE:
`wt -v` probably wont help as it displays the version in a MsgBox which is unhelpful. no stdout at all. strange decision.

After reading around in the Windows terminal (WT) repo, it seems like when running WT will set the env variable `%WT_SESSION%`. neovim can probably look it up and set the terminfo fallback to it.

One issue though it is inherited. that means when running wsl the `%WT_SESSION%` will follow up.

I will see what i can do
https://github.com/microsoft/terminal/issues/8303 mentions `ms-terminal` as the terminfo name.

> [microsoft/terminal#8303](https://github.com/microsoft/terminal/issues/8303) mentions `ms-terminal` as the terminfo name.

~will change the name to ms-terminal.~
I am getting a conflict as ms-terminal already exist in the terminfo database. I dunno if we should override that.

```
[*] Build terminfo database
"<stdin>", line 27855, terminal 'ms-terminal': name multiply defined.
[*] Writing src/nvim/tui/terminfo_defs.h... done
```

on a side note. neovim still uses  vtpcon even for windows terminal . so technically we are virtualizing the terminal.


Another thing is I think ms-terminal terminfo includes the the old command prompt terminal which is a legacy one.
Although windows terminal replaced it already, you can still run the old terminal by running CMD with admin privileges.

I'm very new to Neovim, so unable to provide feedback on your commits.

However, I just tested this out on my machine. I can confirm it works perfectly in both Powershell 7 and in cmd. Colored and styled underlines show when AtlasEngine is enabled, and underlines without styles show when it is not.

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/72696811/fd1557b6-465d-4b0b-8d82-b7660654eb8a)

after some testing it seems like adding Setulc caused some issue when scrolling around . was noticed when using nvim-tree plugin but I recon this will also affect multiple windows. Removing the parameter reserve the ability of windows terminal to render the underlines and the colors so only smlux was needed.
Is there anything left to be done here?
Fix the failing tests and squash your commits?

> Fix the failing tests and squash your commits?

thanks. I am new to git. will look it up
I tried changing getenv() to os_getenv() as recommended by lint. it compiles fine in visual studio but does not pass the test. any ideas to proceed?

> Looks great.
> 
> You can apply the suggested changes and see if it helps.

it compiles in msvc. getting this on lint check

```
FAIL: /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/tui/terminfo.c (File size changed from 8862 to 8861)
```
Run `make format` locally.

> Run `make format` locally.

Thanks.
it passes lint now.
Now FreeBSD is complaingin but looks like an issue with the script.

There seems to still be some problems:
- The new terminfo entry is not added to `scripts/update_terminfo.sh`, so it will be removed when the script is next run.
- The new terminfo entry is mostly a copy of `vtpcon`, which may lead to future mistakes (e.g. only updating one entry when both should be updated).

So I'm starting to think https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27629#issuecomment-1975770891 is a better approach. I've opened a PR #28035 for that.

> There seems to still be some problems:
> 
>     * The new terminfo entry is not added to `scripts/update_terminfo.sh`, so it will be removed when the script is next run.
> 
>     * The new terminfo entry is mostly a copy of `vtpcon`, which may lead to future mistakes (e.g. only updating one entry when both should be updated).
> 
> 
> So I'm starting to think [#27629 (comment)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27629#issuecomment-1975770891) is a better approach. I've opened a PR #28035 for that.

Thanks for doing that.

I will start by adding the entry in the `update_terminfo.sh` for now so we have the option. I will try also to mess with the script so it will generate the add terminfo out of the existing vtpcon if possible to avoid issues in the future. 

Its fine by me. you decide what is the best for the project .
